benchmark_details.name: DreamFrame
benchmark_details.overview: DreamFrame is a novel framework for generating video instruction tuning datasets that includes style-consistent keyframes and corresponding question-answer pairs for enhancing video understanding in large vision-language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To generate high-quality, style-consistent video instruction datasets that enhance the performance of vision-language models for video understanding tasks.

data.source: Automatically generated from structured movie plots using an LLM and diffusion models.
data.size: 1,000 stylized videos and 100,000 diverse QA pairs

methodology.calculation: Performance is validated against existing benchmarks on multi-modal video understanding tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment between video and question answering.
methodology.baseline_results: DreamFrame-7B surpasses previous LVLMs (e.g., VideoLLaVA-7B) by an average margin of 2.2% on MVBench.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation on various existing benchmarks.
